title: Penelope's Experiences in Scotland; Being Extracts from the Commonplace Book of Penelope Hamilton
author: Wiggin, Kate Douglas Smith
snippet: I lo'e the gentry o' the North,      The Southern men I lo'e,    The canty people o' the West,      The Paisley bodies too. The pawky folk o' Fife are dear,--      Sae dear are ane an' a',    That e'en to think that we maun pairt      Maist braks my hairt in twa.

title: The Story of My Life; Recollections and Reflections
author: Terry, Ellen
snippet: I suppose it is its very assertiveness that makes one forget the very sweet voices that also exist in America. The Southern voice is very low in tone and soothing, like the "darkey" voice. It is as different from Yankee as the Yorkshire burr is from the Cockney accent.
